definitions.text: the month following February and preceding April
the act of marching; walking with regular steps (especially in a procession of some kind)
examples: we heard the sound of marching

definitions.text: a procession of people walking together
examples: the march went up Fifth Avenue

definitions.text: district consisting of the area on either side of a border or boundary of a country or an area
examples: the Welsh marches between England and Wales

definitions.text: genre of music written for marching
a degree granted for the successful completion of advanced study of architecture

examples: They processed into the dining room
The Japanese marched their prisoners through Manchuria

definitions.text: walk fast, with regular or measured steps; walk with a stride
examples: He marched into the classroom and announced the exam
The soldiers marched across the border

definitions.text: march in protest; take part in a demonstration
examples: Thousands demonstrated against globalization during the meeting of the most powerful economic nations in Seattle
She parades her new husband around town

definitions.text: cause to march or go at a marching pace
examples: They marched the mules into the desert

definitions.text: lie adjacent to another or share a boundary
